intro: Centrosema capitatum, commonly known as the yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along streambanks. Centrosema capitatum plays a role in soil stabilization and supports local biodiversity.
